Column Comment.0: RATE SCHEDULE IDENTIFIER: unique indentifier for the fee schedule.
Column Comment.1: R RATE TYPE: the type of rate charged in this schedule. Examples may includeposting fees, expenses, title search, copy charges, rentals etc.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: CURRENCY CONVERSION RATE: the rate applied to convert the currency from itsoriginal monetary UOM to the stored UOM. This value is valid for this row in this tableonly. When this value is multiplied by the STORED currency value, the original valueof the transaction in the original currency is obtained.
Column Comment.4: CURRENCY ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: the currency in which the funds wereinitially received. When the Stored currency is multiplied by the CURRENCYCONVERSION, the value of the transaction in the original currency is obtained.
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.7: CURRENCY CONVERSION RATE: the rate applied to convert the currency from itsNational monetary UOM to the stored UOM. This value is valid for this row in thistable only. When this value is multiplied by the STORED currency value, the originalvalue of the transaction in the National currency is obtained.
Column Comment.8: NATIONAL CURRENCY UNIT OF MEASURE: the currency units that are used asthe national currency relevant to this fee schedule.
Column Comment.9: PERIOD TYPE: Measures a period of time, such as a month, day or year.
Column Comment.10: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.11: RATE CONDITION: A list of conditions that are applied to a rate schedule. Forexample a road accrss rate may only apply when a well is in production or duringdrilling operations.
Column Comment.12: RATE OR FEE COST: the total (gross) cost of this fee in the stored units of measure.
Column Comment.13: RATE COST UNIT OF MEASURE: whether the rate is charged per km, per hectareetc.
Column Comment.14: RATE OR FEE FORMULA: Calculation formula used to determine the actual amountto be paid through this fee. May be expressed as a SQL statement if desired.
Column Comment.15: RATE OR FEE PERCENTAGE: Percent of the fee that is charged, such as a 7% tax,or a 15% shipping charge.
Column Comment.16: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.17: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.18: TAXABLE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this portion of the rateschedule is subject to tax.
Column Comment.19: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.21: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.23: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
